images.copyright: A fossilised carboniferous fern (© Juan Carlos Munoz/Minden Pictures)
images.title: Palaeontology meets art
images.caption: Palaeontology meets art
images.desc: Though it looks like a fresco from Ancient Greece, these are the fossilised remains of a fern found in Córdoba, Spain. The fossil dates back to the Carboniferous period, roughly 350 million years ago. This is a compression fossil - where a small amount of the original plant material was retained with the mineral deposits that help form the impression.
